intro: Phylica retorta, commonly known as the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruit capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance. Phylica retorta is also valued for its ecological role, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
